meanings.sent1: The leading car had bright headlights to show the way.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide was leading the group through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The leading duck in the pond was wearing a tiny captain's hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a leading beacon in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The leading star in the sky guided the lost travelers.

meanings.sent1: He crossed the finish line leading in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team started leading and maintained their position throughout the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat sprinted leading through the obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed leading down the mountain, carving its path.
meanings.sent5: The melody began leading in the musical composition.

meanings.sent1: The leading lighthouse helped ships navigate safely.
meanings.sent2: The leading teacher directed the students in the science experiment.
meanings.sent3: The leading squirrel in the park was giving directions to other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her leading hand gestures guided the dancers on stage.
meanings.sent5: The leading signpost pointed travelers in the right direction.

meanings.sent1: The leading scientist made groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent2: The leading actor stole the show with their performance.
meanings.sent3: The leading cake at the party was the most delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her leading opinion swayed the group's decision.
meanings.sent5: The leading character in the story had the most impact.

meanings.definition: Ahead of others in a race or competition
meanings.sent1: The leading runner crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The leading team scored the winning goal in the match.
meanings.sent3: The leading horse in the race wore a tiny crown on its head.
meanings.sent4: Her leading speed on the track left her competitors behind.
meanings.sent5: The leading cyclist pedaled furiously towards the finish line.
